An information system is a triple S = (E, \mathsf{Con} , \vdash ), where
E is a set,
\mathsf{Con} \subseteq \mathcal{P} ( E ) is a collection of finite subsets of E, and
\_ \vdash \_ \subseteq \mathsf{Con} \times E a binary relation, subject to the following conditions
\mathsf{Con} is downards-closed w.r.t. the subset ordering.
The singleton set \{ x \} \in \mathsf{Con} for every x \in E.
If U \vdash x then U \cup \{ x \} \in \mathsf{Con}.
If U \in \mathsf{Con} and x \in U then U \vdash x.
If U \vdash x for all x \in V and V \vdash y then U \vdash y.
